[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Tactical Control System (TCS) defines requirements to optimize UAV operations, enhance mission efficiency, and ensure seamless data management across military networks.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: TCS supports real-time UAV control, mission planning, and data sharing across C4I systems.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: TCS integrates with UAVs, mission tools, and C4I systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: TCS provides graphical interfaces for operators and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: TCS runs on scalable military-compliant hardware.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: TCS supports EPICS-based mission tool integrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The system optimizes memory use for UAV operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: TCS ensures 24/7 availability with automated failover and system recovery to minimize downtime.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: TCS links with mission planning and analytics tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: TCS supports UAV control, data management, and operator training.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include UAV operators, administrators, and planners.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: TCS depends on stable networks and compliant hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: TCS requires operational C4I systems, EPICS, and UAV tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: C4I: Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Intelligence
EPICS: Experimental Physics Industrial Control System

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with mission tools for UAV operations.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall exchange data with C4I systems.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable UAV mission planning (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide UAV monitoring and control (REQ-DB-24, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide configurable dashboards.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support multilingual interfaces.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process UAV commands within 3 seconds (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 500 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store mission data and telemetry (REQ-FUNC-12).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support role-based access, encrypt mission data, and log audit trails.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular design for scalability and comply with MIL-STD-498.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall meet military cybersecurity standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall comply with UAV interoperability protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale to support additional UAVs.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log and audit critical operations for mission tracking.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Workflows, user manuals, UAV integration procedures, and operator training materials, flight control, and emergency response scenarios.
[SEC] 5. References: MIL-STD-498, EPICS, UAV protocols, and TCP/IP guidelines.
